value:
I might not look it, but I really
do hope for peace.$k$pI've always got my lance handy,
but there's nothing more precious
to me than a kingdom at ease.

I always worry about my sister,
Eirika. If I'm not there to protect
her, anything could happen.

You're always looking after us.
That sort of kindness reminds me of
my sister. Must be why I like you.

You say weapons are shaped like
your Breidablik back in your world?
I'd like to visit and see that for myself.

The royalty of other worlds seem to
prefer the sword. I like the lance.
Lances have the edge over swords.$k$pYou know, I once had ambitions to
be the greatest spearman on Magvel,
the continent I call home.

I'm Ephraim. Now, how about we cut
this short and get to sparring? It's a
better way to get to know each other.

My power grows. But I mustn't
let it go to my head.

I must get more powerful.
And I will.

How can I ever protect my
sister at this rate?

I will be the master of my power.
Not the reverse.

I am Ephraim of Renais, a prince
and skilled spearman. So, point me
at my enemy. I'll get to work.

It seems that I've gotten much
stronger here. My power has grown
almost to overflowing.$k$pThat isn't enough. Oh, I don't mean
my strength. I've always been
capable enough there.$k$pI mean that strength isn't always
enough to protect us. Yes, it
helps force a foe to submit.$k$pBut strength can also blind one
to others' feelings. That is exactly
how I once lost a good friend.$k$pI must become kinder and more
compassionate, or else I risk
repeating my mistakes.$k$pYou have those qualities. And
so I must remain with you.
Then I will learn all I need to.$k$pYou'll find that I'm a grateful
student...and friend.
はぁっ！
ふんっ！
うああっ！
I can still fight!
Coming through!
Wonderful!
Give me more—more!
All right. Let's fight!
Eirika...
Heh heh
You can rely on me for anything you require.
Oh! Don't startle me. You almost met with the tip of my lance.
Trust me. I don't pick fights I can't win.
You know, I like you. And I feel I can trust you completely.
Here's some advice. Let the fools spread gossip. The rest of us have work to do.
I must protect Eirika, as a brother ought to do for his sister.
I will protect you. Just believe in me and follow my lead.
All right.
Onward.
Leave it to me.
